'''Shirley  Griffith''' (April 26, 1908 – June 18, 1974)<ref name="AMG">[http://www.allmusic.com/cg/amg.dll Allmusic.com - accessed  February 2010]</ref> was an [[United States|American]] [[blues]] [[singing|singer]] and [[guitarist]], mainly based in [[Indianapolis]]. He is best known for his [[sound recording and reproduction|recordings]], "Walkin' Blues" and "Bad Luck Blues".<ref name="Dead">[http://thedeadrockstarsclub.com/1970.html Thedeadrockstarsclub.com - accessed February 2010]</ref> 

Griffith was born in [[Brandon, Mississippi|Brandon]], [[Mississippi]], [[United States]].<ref name="AMG"/> He died from [[heart disease]] in Indianapolis in June 1974, at the age of 66.<ref name="Dead"/> He had three children Elonza Griffith (deceased), Walter James Griffith and Mary T. Griffith. His first wife was Addie B. McNeil (deceased) and his second wife Elizabeth (deceased). He was the second child born to Willie and Maggie Griffith. He had five sisters and three brothers, one brother Robert Griffith and one sister Bealuah Griffith-Myers are living.
